sentence.Network_en: He examined the ads in " The New Yorker " and " Esquire. "
sentence.Network_cn: 他翻阅了《纽约人 》 和《绅士 》 杂志上的不少广告.

sentence.Network_en: This was said in an Esquire interview on april 23, 2008.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是说,在一个君子采访时对2008年4月23日.

sentence.Network_en: Trends Esquire display in newsstand in an impressive and eye - catching way.
sentence.Network_cn: 《时尚先生》在报摊亭的醒目摆放,强烈吸引读者眼球.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 曾被君子（Esquire）杂志评为人类有史以来最糟糕建筑的柳京饭店，预计明年盛大开幕。不过韩国专家质疑，柳京恐有倒塌危机。
曾被《时尚先生（esquire）》（Esquire）杂志评为“人类有史以来最糟糕建筑”的朝鲜柳京饭店（Ryugyong Hotel）在停建16年之后，已经开始重 …
接受君子杂志（Esquire）访问，对报派绯闻颇有微词，个性爽朗没啥心机，很容易和大夥打成一片，和很多男生都是好哥儿们，不可 …
绅士（Esquire）：中世纪时，绅士可以作为爵士头衔的候选人。现在指在身份上低于爵士一级的人士。

jx.jx_en_mean: (historical)an officer in charge of dressing and undressing the king

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French esquier, from Latin scutarius 'shield-bearer', from scutum 'shield'; compare with squire. Sense 2 was the original denotation, sense 1 being at first a courtesy title given to such a person

entry.tran: 先生（用于男子姓名后表尊敬，尤用于信封上）
entry.def: Esquire is a formal title that can be used after a man's name if he has no other title, especially on an envelope that is addressed to him.

means.word_mean: 1. (Middle Ages) an attendant and shield bearer to a knight; a candidate for knighthood

auth_sentence.content: One Isaac Bickerstaff, a Pretended Esquire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One Isaac Bickerstaff, a Pretended Esquire.

auth_sentence.content: The long night of the initiation of the Esquire into Knighthood.
auth_sentence.res_content: The long night of the initiation of the Esquire into Knighthood.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The long night of the initiation of the Esquire into Knighthood.

auth_sentence.content: Mailer was livid, and briefly refused to write for Esquire.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mailer was livid, and briefly refused to write for Esquire.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mailer was livid, and briefly refused to write for Esquire.
